name: Stock Market Insider Tips Scam
description: Scammer poses as a SEBI-registered analyst offering guaranteed stock tips through a premium channel, collecting subscription fees via UPI and bank transfer for worthless or manipulated stock advice.

turns.scammer_message: VIP STOCK TIP: SEBI registered analyst here. Buy XYZ Ltd at Rs 45, target Rs 150 in 7 days. 100% guaranteed profit. Join premium channel for daily tips. Limited seats.
turns.notes: Initial bait with fake SEBI credentials and impossible guaranteed stock returns.

turns.scammer_message: Glad you're interested! Our premium channel members earned 400% returns last month. The subscription fee is just Rs 5,000 for 3 months of daily tips. You will recover this amount in your very first trade. Pay via UPI to stocktips.premium@ybl to get instant access.
turns.notes: Scammer reveals UPI ID for subscription fee collection with exaggerated returns claims.

turns.scammer_message: For your convenience, you can also call our research team at +91-8811994455. They can share today's tip for free as a trial. After that, you'll want to join premium for sure. We also accept bank transfer to account 6655443322110099 (Yes Bank) for the subscription.
turns.notes: Scammer provides phone number and bank account details, offering a free trial as hook.

turns.scammer_message: UPDATE: Our yesterday's tip gave 35% profit! Members who joined last week already made Rs 1,50,000+. Don't miss tomorrow's blockbuster tip. Subscribe now - Rs 5,000 to stocktips.premium@ybl or call +91-8811994455 for details. Hurry, only 10 premium seats left!
turns.notes: Scammer uses fake profit reports and scarcity to pressure for subscription payment.

turns.scammer_message: FINAL OFFER: Join today and get 6 months access for the price of 3! Pay Rs 5,000 to stocktips.premium@ybl or transfer to account 6655443322110099. Tomorrow's tip alone can give you 50% returns. Call +91-8811994455 NOW. After today, subscription goes to Rs 15,000!
turns.notes: Final pressure with discounted offer, price increase threat, and all payment details repeated.
